translated: the unequalled rejoicing, having rejoiced, the roots of virtue produced from that rejoicing are made into a common karmic lot with all sentient beings and are dedicated to the attainment of unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /

analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa la dmigs pa med pa dag gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs pa de dag mtshan mar bzung nas de dag gis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste dam
translated: If those who have no object of observation of a nonthing, by apprehending the signs of those bhagavƒÅn buddhas who dwell in all the infinite world systems of the ten directions, from the time of their first generating the mind of enlightenment up toüîΩ

original: pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yin pa dag dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa pa slob pa dang / mi slob pa de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad mngon par bsdus te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /

translated: If those who have no object of observation that is a non-thing, in all the infinite world systems of the ten directions, having taken as a sign those Bhagavan Buddhas who dwell there, and having thoroughly combined all the roots of virtue of those [Buddhas] from the time they first generated the thought of awakening up to the time of the abiding of the true doctrine, and the roots of virtue of those in the Hearer Vehicle who are in training and those who are beyond training, and having thoroughly dedicated those to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment,

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes phyin ci log pa dang / sems phyin ci log pa dang / lta ba phyin ci log pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde zhes bya ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag ces @53a *//
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes phyin ci log pa dang / sems phyin ci log pa dang / lta ba phyin ci log pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde zhes bya ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag ces @53a *//
translated: then, with regard to the impermanent, they have a mistaken ideation that it is permanent, a mistaken mind, a mistaken view, and with regard to suffering, they say it is happiness, and with regard to what is not a self, they say it is a self.

original: bya ba dang / mi sdug pa la sdug ces bya bar 'du shes phyin ci log pa dang / sems phyin ci log pa dang / lta ba phyin ci log pa ji lta ba bzhin du de'ang phyin ci log par mi 'gyur grang /
analyzed: bya ba dang / mi sdug pa la sdug ces bya bar 'du shes phyin ci log pa dang / sems phyin ci log pa dang / lta ba phyin ci log pa ji lta ba bzhin du de'ang phyin ci log par mi 'gyur grang /
translated: ‚ÄúHow could it be that, just as the perception is mistaken, the mind is mistaken, and the view is mistaken, in that what is impermanent is taken to be permanent, what is suffering is taken to be happiness, and what is impure is taken to be pure, in the same way, awakening would not be mistaken?

original: ji ste dngos po ji lta ba dang / dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub kyang de lta bu yin la /
analyzed: ji ste dngos po ji lta ba dang / dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub kyang de lta bu yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúIf things are just as they are, and if the object is just as it is, then awakening is just like that.

original: sems kyang de bzhin /
analyzed: sems kyang de bzhin /
translated: The mind is just like that.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de bzhin /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de bzhin /
translated: The perfection of generosity, the perfection of good conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of meditation, and the perfection of wisdom are just like that.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang de bzhin /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang de bzhin /
translated: The thirty-seven factors of awakening are just like that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang de kho na bzhin pa zhig yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang de kho na bzhin pa zhig yin la /
translated: The powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are just like that.

analyzed: de ltar gal te dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa'ang de bzhin te /
translated: If things are just as they are apprehended,

analyzed: byang chub kyang de lta bu yin la /
translated: enlightenment is just like that.

original: sems kyang de bzhin /
analyzed: sems kyang de bzhin /
translated: The mind is just like that.

original: gzugs kyang de bzhin /
analyzed: gzugs kyang de bzhin /

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang de bzhin /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are just like that.

original: mig kyang de bzhin /
analyzed: mig kyang de bzhin /
translated: The eyes are just like that.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang de bzhin /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang de bzhin /
translated: The ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are just like that.

analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du'ang de bzhin /

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / @53b stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam yang de bzhin /

translated: the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the path are like that;

original: stobs bcu'ang de bzhin /
analyzed: stobs bcu'ang de bzhin /
translated: the ten powers are like that;

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyang de bzhin /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyang de bzhin /

translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges are like that;

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang de bzhin pa zhig yin na / de la dngos po ni /

original: gang yin / dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: gang yin / dmigs pa ni /
translated: What is an object of observation?

original: gang yin / ting nge 'dzin ni /
analyzed: gang yin / ting nge 'dzin ni /
translated: What is meditative stabilization?

original: gang yin / sems ni /
analyzed: gang yin / sems ni /
translated: What is a mind?

original: gang yin / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ni; gang yin /
analyzed: gang yin / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ni; gang yin /
translated: What are wholesome roots?

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i sems gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i sems gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni /
translated: What is the thought that arises from rejoicing that is dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: gang yin / byams pas smras pa /
analyzed: gang yin / byams pas smras pa /
translated: Maitreya replied,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod spyod pa'ang yin la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod spyod pa'ang yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúIf those bodhisattva great beings have practiced the six perfections,

original: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byed pa'ang yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byed pa'ang yin /
translated: have attended on many buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed bskyed pa'ang yin /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed bskyed pa'ang yin /

analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'ang yin /

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la slob slob pa'ang yin na ni /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la slob slob pa'ang yin na ni /
translated: and have trained in the dharmas that are empty of their own marks,

original: de dag gis dngos po de dag dang / dmigs pa de dag dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de dag mtshan mar bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: de dag gis dngos po de dag dang / dmigs pa de dag dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de dag mtshan mar bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar mi byed kyi /
translated: then they should not take those things, those objects, those lord buddhas, those wholesome roots, and that wholesome action that consists in the merit that is the cause of rejoicing as a causal sign and dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gnyis su med pa'i tshul dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul ji lta ba de bzhin du yongs su bsngo bar byed de /üîΩdmigs pa'i tshul @54a *//
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i tshul dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul ji lta ba de bzhin du yongs su bsngo bar byed de / dmigs pa'i tshul @54a *//
translated: They dedicate in such a way that accords with the way of nonduality and the way of signlessness.üîΩThey do not dedicate in such a way that accords with the way of reference points,

original: dang / dmigs pa med pa'i tshul dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshul dang / rnam par byang ba'i tshul dang / skye ba'i tshul dang / 'gag pa'i tshul gyis ni /üîΩma yin no //
analyzed: dang / dmigs pa med pa'i tshul dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshul dang / rnam par byang ba'i tshul dang / skye ba'i tshul dang / 'gag pa'i tshul gyis ni / ma yin no //
translated: the way of the absence of reference points, the way of affliction, the way of purification, the way of arising, or the way of cessation.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la'ang ma bslab /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la'ang ma bslab /

original: sangs rgyas mang po la'ang bsnyen bkur ma byas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la'ang bsnyen bkur ma byas /

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang ma bskyed /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang ma bskyed /
translated: have not planted the roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis kyang yongs su ma zin /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis kyang yongs su ma zin /

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la'ang ma bslab na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la'ang ma bslab na /
translated: and have not trained in the phenomena that are empty of their own characteristics,

original: de dag gis ni /
analyzed: de dag gis ni /

original: dngos po de dag dang / dmigs pa de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i sems bskyed pa de dag mtshan mar bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po de dag dang / dmigs pa de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i sems bskyed pa de dag mtshan mar bzung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will take those things, those objects, those wholesome roots, and those thoughts of generating the mind of enlightenment that arise from rejoicing as having signs, and they will dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subh≈´ti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ltar bstan pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ltar bstan pa 'di ni /
translated: this teaching of the perfection of wisdom

original: theg pa la gsar du yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mdun du brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa la gsar du yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mdun du brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: should not be spoken in the presence of a bodhisattva who has newly set out in the vehicle.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Similarly, it should not be spoken in the presence of a bodhisattva who has newly set out in the vehicle for the perfection of meditative stabilization, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, or the perfection of giving.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: and the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities should not be taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i dad pa tsam dang / dang ba tsam dang / dga' ba tsam dang / gus pa tsam yod pa gang yin pa de'ang med par @54b 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dad pa tsam dang / dang ba tsam dang / dga' ba tsam dang / gus pa tsam yod pa gang yin pa de'ang med par @54b 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because whatever little faith, little clarity, little delight, and little respect they have will disappear.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mdun du ni /üîΩbrjod par bya /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mdun du ni / brjod par bya /
translated: But in the presence of irreversible bodhisattva great beingsüîΩit should be taught,

original: bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: bstan par bya ste /
translated: it should be explained,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams kyi bar du'ang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams kyi bar du'ang bstan par bya'o //
translated: up to and the emptiness of phenomena that are empty of their own marks should be taught.

original: de ni / de lta bu thos na /üîΩmi skrag / mi dngang zhing /
analyzed: de ni / de lta bu thos na / mi skrag / mi dngang zhing /
translated: When they hear that,üîΩthey will not be frightened, terrified,

original: dngang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or become terrified.

original: gal te de dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis zin la /
analyzed: gal te de dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis zin la /
translated: If they are assisted by a spiritual friend,

original: sngon gyi rgyal ba dag la lhag par bya ba byas shing dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal ba dag la lhag par bya ba byas shing dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: and who has served many buddhas,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o ////
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o ////
translated: Venerable Subh≈´ti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa; bam po nyi shu drug pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa; bam po nyi shu drug pa /
translated: that bodhisattva great being should dedicate the merit made by rejoicing in that way to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: byams pa / sems gang gis rjes su yi rang nas yongs su bsngo bar byed pa'i sems de ni /üîΩzad cing 'gag la med de /
analyzed: byams pa / sems gang gis rjes su yi rang nas yongs su bsngo bar byed pa'i sems de ni / zad cing 'gag la med de /
translated: ‚ÄúMaitreya, the mind by which one rejoices and dedicates

original: rnam par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par gyur pa yin la /
translated: is exhausted, ceased, and gone.

original: dngos po de dag dang / dmigs pa de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / rjes su yi rang pa'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de'ang zad cing 'gag la med de /
analyzed: dngos po de dag dang / dmigs pa de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / rjes su yi rang pa'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de'ang zad cing 'gag la med de /
translated: Those things, those objects, those roots of virtue, and that merit produced from rejoicing in those things will be exhausted, cease, and disappear.

original: rnam par gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: rnam par gyur pa yin na /
translated: If those things, those objects, those wholesome roots, and that wholesome action of rejoicing were to cease, end, be destroyed, and perish,

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i sems de ni /üîΩgang yin / dngos po de dag ni /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i sems de ni / gang yin / dngos po de dag ni /
translated: then what would be the mind that rejoices?üîΩWhat would be those things?

original: gang yin / dmigs pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang yin / dmigs pa de dag ni /

original: gang yin / dge ba'i rtsa ba gang @55a *//
analyzed: gang yin / dge ba'i rtsa ba gang @55a *//
translated: What would be those wholesome roots

analyzed: dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni /

original: gang yin / ci /
analyzed: gang yin / ci /
translated: What is it that is dedicated?

original: sems kyis sems yongs su bsngo'am /
analyzed: sems kyis sems yongs su bsngo'am /

original: gal te sems kyis sems yongs su bsngo na ni /
analyzed: gal te sems kyis sems yongs su bsngo na ni /

original: sems gnyis phrad par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: sems gnyis phrad par 'gyur ba med de /

original: sems kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /

original: yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so //
translated: cannot be dedicated.

original: byams pas smras pa /
analyzed: byams pas smras pa /
translated: Maitreya said:

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa dang / gzugs dngos po med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa dang / gzugs dngos po med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang /
translated: the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity are non-entities, and that form, feeling, perception, volitional factors,üîΩand consciousness are non-entities,

original: rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dngos po med pa dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dngos po med pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dngos po med pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dngos po med pa dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dngos po med pa dang /
translated: the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are not things, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not things,

original: byang chub dngos po med par shes na /
analyzed: byang chub dngos po med par shes na /
translated: and awakening is not a thing.

original: 'di ltar / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, a bodhisattva great being should dedicate the merit made from rejoicing to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gal te de ltar bsngos na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bsngos na /
translated: If it is dedicated like that,

original: bla na med @55b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa yin no //
analyzed: bla na med @55b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa yin no //
translated: it is dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The bodhisattva great being Maitreya said to the elder Subh≈´ti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /üîΩtheg pa la gsar du yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bstan pa 'di thos na skrag ste /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor / theg pa la gsar du yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bstan pa 'di thos na skrag ste /
translated: Venerable Subh≈´ti,

original: dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur grang /
analyzed: dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur grang /
translated: if the bodhisattva great beings who have newly set out in the vehicle hear this teaching, will they not be afraid, terrified, and filled with dread?

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subh≈´ti,

original: theg pa la gsar du yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya /
analyzed: theg pa la gsar du yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya /
translated: how should the bodhisattva great beings who have newly set out in the vehicle dedicate those roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yongs su bzung ba'ang ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yongs su bzung ba'ang ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur /
translated: How should they dedicate the merit that arises from rejoicing to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti replied,üîΩ‚ÄúKau≈õika,

original: byams pa / gal te theg pa la gsar du yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod la /
analyzed: byams pa / gal te theg pa la gsar du yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod la /
translated: Maitreya, if a bodhisattva great being who has newly set out in the Great Vehicle practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin gyi; mtshan ma'i tshul gyis ma yin pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin gyi; mtshan ma'i tshul gyis ma yin pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: and also apprehends that perfection of wisdom by way of not apprehending it, not by way of an objective image, and similarly practices the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod la /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod la /
translated: the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin gyi /
translated: and also apprehends that perfection of generosity by way of not apprehending it,

original: mtshan ma'i tshul gyis ma yin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la @56a *//
analyzed: mtshan ma'i tshul gyis ma yin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la @56a *//
translated: not by way of an objective image, and practices inner emptiness,

original: spyod la / nang stong pa nyid de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: spyod la / nang stong pa nyid de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin gyi /
translated: and also apprehends that inner emptiness by way of not apprehending it,

original: mtshan ma'i tshul gyis ma yin pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod la /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i tshul gyis ma yin pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod la /
translated: They practice the emptiness of internal phenomena, but they do so without apprehending anything.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin gyi /
translated: They practice the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of essential nature with respect to non-apprehension, but they do so without apprehending anything.

original: mtshan ma'i tshul gyis ma yin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la spyod la; byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun de dag kyang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin gyi /üîΩmtshan ma'i tshul gyis ma yin pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod la /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i tshul gyis ma yin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la spyod la; byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun de dag kyang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin gyi / mtshan ma'i tshul gyis ma yin pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod la /
translated: They practice the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, but they do so without apprehending anything.üîΩThey practice the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, but they do so without apprehending anything.üîΩThey practice the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, but they do so without apprehending anything.

original: de dag kyang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin gyi /üîΩmtshan ma'i tshul gyis ma yin no //

translated: They practice the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, but they do so without apprehending anything.

analyzed: de ltar na /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang bskyed pa dag dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu'ang sems bskyed pa de dag thams cad yongs su bsdus nas gcig tu brtul cing gzhal te rjes su yi rang ba'i mchog gis rjes su yi rang ba dang /
translated: having generated roots of virtue, and having generated the mind set on unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, having gathered them all together, having combined them into one, having weighed them, I rejoice with the highest rejoicing,

original: rjes su yi rang ba phul du byung ba dang / gtso bo dang / rab dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pas rjes su yi rang ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba mnyam pa med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas rjes su yi rang ste /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba phul du byung ba dang / gtso bo dang / rab dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pas rjes su yi rang ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba mnyam pa med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas rjes su yi rang ste /
translated: with excellent rejoicing, with preeminent rejoicing, with the best rejoicing, with the most excellent rejoicing, with the most sublime rejoicing, with incomparable rejoicing, with rejoicing equal to the unequaled.

original: rjes su yi rang nas kyang de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed de /üîΩgal te chos de dag ni /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang nas kyang de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed de / gal te chos de dag ni /
translated: and having rejoiced, they dedicate all of that to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: zad pa dang / 'gag pa dang / med pa dang / rnam par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: zad pa dang / 'gag pa dang / med pa dang / rnam par gyur pa yin la /
translated: If those dharmas are exhausted, ceased, non-existent, and transformed,

original: gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i chos de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gang du yongs su bsngo ba'i chos de'ang rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: and the dharma into which they are dedicated is also empty of inherent nature,

original: zhes de ltar yang dag par shes te /
analyzed: zhes de ltar yang dag par shes te /

original: gal te de ltar yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yongs su bsngo na /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
translated: it is a dedication to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: gal @59a *// te chos rnams kyis chos rnams yongs su bsngo bar mi byed de /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar / chos thams cad ni /

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya bar de ltar yang dag par shes la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro // zhes bya bar de ltar yang dag par shes la /
translated: are empty of inherent nature.üîΩIf they know it to be so,

original: gal te de ltar yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yongs su bsngo na /

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba yin no //

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang / brtson 'grus dang / bzod pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i 'du shes phyin ci log pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang / brtson 'grus dang / bzod pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i 'du shes phyin ci log pa dang /
translated: ‚ÄúBodhisattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom like that, and practicing the perfections of concentration, perseverance, patience, morality, and giving, do not have distorted perception,

analyzed: sems phyin ci log pa dang / lta ba phyin ci log par mi 'gyur ro //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar / yongs su bsngo ba de dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / byang chub de dang / sems de la mngon par zhen pa med cing /

original: gang du mngon par zhen pa de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang du mngon par zhen pa de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: and do not see anywhere that they settle down.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, what do you think?

original: de ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings‚Äô dedication to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du byed pa de /

analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis dben par yang dag par shes shing /

analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyis dben par yang dag par shes /

analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag gis dben par yang dag par shes /

analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po dag gis dben par yang dag par shes na /

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa yin no //üîΩgal te byang chub sems dpas rjes su yi rang ba'i mdo las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa yin no // gal te byang chub sems dpas rjes su yi rang ba'i mdo las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ni /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings have dedicated the thing that is the basis of merit to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.üîΩIf the bodhisattvas know that the thing that is the basis of merit that arises from rejoicing

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyis dben pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa'ang mngon par 'du byed pa'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa dang /
translated: those roots of virtue are also void of the nature of roots of virtue,üîΩthat mental activity is also void of the nature of mental activity,üîΩthat thought of awakening is also void of the nature of the thought of awakening,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyang byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyis dben pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyi rang bzhin gyis dben pa dang / byang chub kyang byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyis dben pa dang /

analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan dang / brtson 'grus dang / bzod pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang rang bzhin gyis dben pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar yang rang bzhin gyis dben pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is also empty of the nature of the perfection of wisdom, and similarly, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity are also empty of the nature of the perfection of generosity,üîΩand inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature are also empty of the nature of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rang bzhin gyis dben par yang dag par shes na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rang bzhin gyis dben par yang dag par shes na /
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are also empty of the nature of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.üîΩ‚Äú

original: 'di ltar rnam par brtag par bya ste /üîΩsku de dag dang / mngon par 'du mdzad pa de dag ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par brtag par bya ste / sku de dag dang / mngon par 'du mdzad pa de dag ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this regard, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom should investigate as follows:üîΩ‚ÄòThose physical forms, those wholesome roots, those formative predispositions, and those mental states that are dedicated to unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment are all nonexistent.

original: 'gag pa yin na /üîΩ'on kyang mtshan mar bzung nas rnam par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: 'gag pa yin na /üîΩ'on kyang mtshan mar bzung nas rnam par rtog par byed de /
translated: If those physical forms, those wholesome roots, those formative predispositions, and those mental states that are dedicated to unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment are all nonexistent,üîΩthen how can those physical forms, those wholesome roots, those formative predispositions, and those mental states that are dedicated to unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment be the transcendent perfection of wisdom?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du mdzad pa de dag dang / sems bskyed pa de dag mtshan mar bzung @61b nas rnam par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du mdzad pa de dag dang / sems bskyed pa de dag mtshan mar bzung @61b nas rnam par rtog par byed do //
translated: They apprehend the marks of those lord buddhas, those wholesome roots, those activities, and those arousals of the mind, and they conceptualize them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni /
translated: The tathƒÅgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas

original: de ltar mtshan ma'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo ba la rjes su yi rang bar gnang par mi mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan ma'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo ba la rjes su yi rang bar gnang par mi mdzad do //
translated: do not approve of dedicating in that way by apprehending marks.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dag mtshan mar 'dzin cing rnam par brtags nas dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i dmigs pa chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dag mtshan mar 'dzin cing rnam par brtags nas dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i dmigs pa chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of those who apprehend marks and conceptualize the parinirvƒÅ·πáa of the lord buddhas and take that as an object is itself a great object.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo bar 'dod pas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo bar 'dod pas ni /
translated: bodhisattva great beings who want to dedicate those wholesome roots

original: dmigs nas mtshan mar bzung ste yongs su bsngo bar mi bya'o; ;dmigs pa'i 'du shes dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes kyis yongs su bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs nas mtshan mar bzung ste yongs su bsngo bar mi bya'o; ;dmigs pa'i 'du shes dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes kyis yongs su bsngo ba ni /
translated: Having objectified it, one should not dedicate it while grasping at signs.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis don che bar ma gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis don che bar ma gsungs so //
translated: The TathƒÅgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones have not said that a dedication that objectifies and grasps at signs is of great benefit.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsngo ba de ni /
analyzed: bsngo ba de ni /
translated: Because that dedication

original: dug dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dug dang bcas pa /
translated: is poisoned

original: zug rngu dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zug rngu dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and is accompanied by pain.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like, for example,

original: dper na / kha zas bsod pa dug dang sbyar ba /
analyzed: dper na / kha zas bsod pa dug dang sbyar ba /
translated: delicious food mixed with poison.

original: kha dog dang / dri dang ldan pa de la byis pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mis bza' bar bsam nas des de za ba na kha dog dang / dris kyang dga' bar byed la /
analyzed: kha dog dang / dri dang ldan pa de la byis pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mis bza' bar bsam nas des de za ba na kha dog dang / dris kyang dga' bar byed la /
translated: A person of childish nature, thinking to eat it, eats it. When he eats it, he is pleased by its color and taste,

original: zhu ba'i tshe ni /
analyzed: zhu ba'i tshe ni /
translated: but when it is digested,

original: sdug bsngal ba'i rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //

original: de bzhin du 'di la kha cig log par zin pa dang / log par shes pa dang / log par bslab pas don ma rtogs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la kha cig log par zin pa dang / log par shes pa dang / log par bslab pas don ma rtogs te /
translated: Likewise, some people have misunderstood, have wrongly understood, and have wrongly trained in this, and so have not understood the meaning.

original: khong du ma chud par 'di skad du /üîΩrigs kyi bu /
analyzed: khong du ma chud par 'di skad du / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Not having understood it, they say this:

original: khyod tshur shog /üîΩ'das pa dang / ma @62a *//
analyzed: khyod tshur shog / 'das pa dang / ma @62a *//
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, come here!

original: byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dang /
analyzed: byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis thugs dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dang /
translated: The blessed buddhas of the past, present, and future, from the time when they first gave rise to the mind of awakening until they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood and passed into the realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa without any remainder of the aggregates,

original: ji srid du dam pa'i chos nub par ma gyur pa'i bar der shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du mdzad pa gang yin pa rnams dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan dang / brtson 'grus dang /
analyzed: ji srid du dam pa'i chos nub par ma gyur pa'i bar der shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du mdzad pa gang yin pa rnams dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan dang / brtson 'grus dang /
translated: As long as the sublime Dharma has not disappeared, they will practice the perfection of wisdom and thereby create roots of virtue.üîΩSimilarly, they will practice the perfections of concentration, diligence,

translated: patience, discipline, and generosity and thereby create roots of virtue. They will possess the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon pa 'du mdzad pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du mdzad pa rnams dang /

translated: ‚ÄúFrom the time they first gave rise to the mind of awakening until they attained parinirvƒÅ·πáa in the realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa without any remainder of the skandhas, together with the sa·πÖgha of hearers, and for as long as the sacred Dharma remained, they practiced the perfection of wisdom and created roots of virtue.

translated: Similarly, inner emptiness and so on up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature are not included in the desire, form, or formless realms.

analyzed: gzugs dang / gzugs med @64b pa'i khams su gtogs pa ma yin no //

analyzed: des 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dag 'dun dang / rang sangs rgyas dang bcas pa rnams kyi thugs dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste dam pa'i chos ji srid gnas pa'i bar der sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: from the time when the blessed buddhas of the past, future, and present, together with their hearers and solitary buddhas, first gave rise to the mind of awakening until the holy Dharma endures,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med pa'i bar de dag thams cad mngon par bsdus nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / gnyis su med pa'i tshul dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul dang / gos pa med pa'i tshul dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med pa'i bar de dag thams cad mngon par bsdus nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / gnyis su med pa'i tshul dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul dang / gos pa med pa'i tshul dang /
translated: as well as in the perfection of wisdom, and in all the limitless qualities of the buddhas, by fully gathering them all together and then rejoicing in them with the highest rejoicing, in a manner free from apprehending anything, in a manner free from duality, in a manner free from marks, in a manner free from defilement,

analyzed: rjes su yi rang nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar @71b byed na /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo theg pa la gsar du yang dag par zhugs pa @72b dang / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas /

translated: They should make offerings to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and to the holy Dharma of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present, and to the community of disciples of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present, and to the Pratyekabuddhas, and to the Bodhisattvas, from the time when they first began to set their thoughts on enlightenment until they attain the knowledge of a complete buddha, and to the wholesome roots that are connected with the perfection of generosity, and that are connected with morality,

original: bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i bar dang / de ma yin pa gzhan sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad la rjes su yi rang bar 'dod pa des ni /

original: 'di ltar rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /

analyzed: rnam par grol ba ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab kyi de bzhin no //

original: tshad ma mchis par mi bgyid pa lags so //üîΩgzugs yangs par mi bgyid /

original: stobs chung bar mi bgyid /üîΩtshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stobs dang ldan par mi bgyid /

original: stobs chung bar mi bgyid /

analyzed: byang chub dang / sangs rgyas kyi bar du'ang stobs dang ldan par mi bgyid /

analyzed: che ba lags so //

original: gal te theg pa la gsar du yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /üîΩbzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin @82a *//
analyzed: gal te theg pa la gsar du yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin @82a *//
translated: if bodhisattva great beings who have newly set out in the vehicle, relying on the perfection of wisdom, on the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance,

analyzed: pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas 'di snyam du /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄòThe perfection of wisdom

analyzed: gzugs che bar mi bgyid /

analyzed: chung bar mi bgyid pa'o //
translated: do not make it smaller.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bar du che bar mi bgyid /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bar du che bar mi bgyid /
translated: up to do not make a buddha greater,

original: chung bar mi bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: chung bar mi bgyid pa'o //
translated: do not make it smaller.

original: gzugs stobs dang ldan par mi bgyid /
analyzed: gzugs stobs dang ldan par mi bgyid /
translated: do not make form powerful,

original: stobs chung bar mi bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: stobs chung bar mi bgyid pa'o //
translated: do not make it weak.

original: zhes bgyi ba'i bar du 'du shes par gyur na /
analyzed: zhes bgyi ba'i bar du 'du shes par gyur na /
translated: If they have the notion that does that,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar shes su gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: de ltar shes su gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: a bodhisattva great being who knows that

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma lags so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma lags so //
translated: does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di ltar gang gzugs che ba'am /üîΩchung bar bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bar du'ang che ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gzugs che ba'am / chung bar bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bar du'ang che ba'am /
translated: it is because making form greater

original: chung bar bgyid pa de ni /
analyzed: chung bar bgyid pa de ni /
translated: or smaller, up to making a buddha greater or smaller

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa ma lags la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa ma lags la /
translated: is not in accord with the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang gzugs stobs dang ldan par bgyid pa'am /
analyzed: gang gzugs stobs dang ldan par bgyid pa'am /
translated: Making form powerful

original: stobs chung bar bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bar du stobs dang ldan par bgyid pa'am /üîΩstobs chung bar bgyid pa de ni /
analyzed: stobs chung bar bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bar du stobs dang ldan par bgyid pa'am / stobs chung bar bgyid pa de ni /
translated: or to make the Buddhas powerful or weak.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa ma lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa ma lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: That is not the concordant cause of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can la byang chub ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can la byang chub ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because there is no Awakening for one who has the notion of an object.

original: 'di ltar / sems can skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sems can skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom should be known as non-arisen because of the non-arising of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du gzugs skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin skye ba ma mchis par rig @82b par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin skye ba ma mchis par rig @82b par bgyi'o //
translated: Similarly, the perfection of wisdom should be known as non-arisen because of the non-arising of form.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bar du skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skya ba ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bar du skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skya ba ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be known as non-arisen because of the non-arising of the Buddhas.

original: sems can ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sems can ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: Because sentient beings are without an intrinsic nature, the perfection of wisdom should be known to be without an intrinsic nature.

original: gzugs ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: Because form is without an intrinsic nature, the perfection of wisdom should be known to be without an intrinsic nature.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bar du ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bar du ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: Because up to buddhas are without an intrinsic nature, the perfection of wisdom should be known to be without an intrinsic nature.

original: sems can dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sems can dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: Because sentient beings are unreal, the perfection of wisdom should be known to be unreal.

original: gzugs dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: Because form is unreal, the perfection of wisdom should be known to be unreal.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness do not exist, the perfection of wisdom should be known as not existing;

original: sangs rgyas kyi bar du dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bar du dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: because a buddha does not exist, the perfection of wisdom should be known as not existing.

original: sems can stong pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sems can stong pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom should be known as empty because beings are empty.

original: gzugs stong pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs stong pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be known as empty because form is empty.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be known as empty because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bar du stong pa'i @83a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bar du stong pa'i @83a *//
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be known as empty because a buddha is empty.

original: slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: and the perfection of wisdom should be known as empty.

original: de bzhin du sems can mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: Similarly, because of the non-existence of signs and the non-existence of wishes in sentient beings, the perfection of wisdom should be known as without signs and without wishes.

original: gzugs mi tshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs mi tshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: Because of the non-existence of signs and the non-existence of wishes in form, the perfection of wisdom should be known as without signs and without wishes.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: Because of the non-existence of signs and the non-existence of wishes in feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, the perfection of wisdom should be known as without signs and without wishes.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bar du mtshan ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bar du mtshan ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: up to the Buddha is without signs and without wishes, one should know that the perfection of wisdom is without signs and without wishes.

original: de bzhin du sems can dben pa dang / sems can ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa dang / ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can dben pa dang / sems can ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa dang / ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: Similarly, because of the seclusion of beings and the non-existence of beings, one should know that the perfection of wisdom is secluded and non-existent.

original: sems can bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsam gyis mi khyab par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sems can bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsam gyis mi khyab par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: Because of the inconceivability of beings, one should know that the perfection of wisdom is inconceivable.

original: sems can rnam par bshig pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par bshig pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sems can rnam par bshig pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par bshig pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: Because of the non-destruction of beings, one should know that the perfection of wisdom is non-destructive.

original: sems can mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa @83b ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //üîΩgzugs mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ma mchis par rig par bgyi'o //

translated: Because phenomena are inanimate, the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not seen and are not heard.

original: mchod pa'i khyad par gang dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsti stang du bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / ri mor bya ba dang / mchod pa bya bar 'dod pa'i mchod pa'i khyad par de dag des sems bskyed ma thag tu 'grub par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mchod pa'i khyad par gang dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsti stang du bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / ri mor bya ba dang / mchod pa bya bar 'dod pa'i mchod pa'i khyad par de dag des sems bskyed ma thag tu 'grub par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Whatever special offerings he wishes to make to the Blessed Buddhas, with which to honor, venerate, worship, and make offerings to them, as soon as he has the thought, they are accomplished.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He goes from Buddha-field to Buddha-field.

original: nam du'ang ma'i mngal du skye bar mi 'gyur /üîΩnam du'ang mngon par shes pa rnams @86a *//
analyzed: nam du'ang ma'i mngal du skye bar mi 'gyur / nam du'ang mngon par shes pa rnams @86a *//
translated: He is never born from a womb.

original: dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur /
translated: He is never separated from the superknowledges.

original: nyon mongs pa gang dang yang 'grogs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang dang yang 'grogs par mi 'gyur /
translated: He is never accompanied by the afflictions.

original: nyan thos kyi sems dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang yang 'grogs par mi /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang yang 'grogs par mi /
translated: He is never accompanied by the thought of a ≈õrƒÅvaka or the thought of a pratyekabuddha.

original: 'gyur zhing / sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed la /
analyzed: 'gyur zhing / sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed la /
translated: He brings beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed cing /
translated: He purifies his Buddha-field.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
translated: They go from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, those bodhisattva great beings

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnal 'byor du byed do //
translated: are practicing this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Subh≈´ti, there are sons of a good family and daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag gis sangs rgyas brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag mang po dag mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag gis sangs rgyas brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag mang po dag mthong bar gyur la /
translated: who have seen many hundreds of buddhas, many thousands of buddhas, many hundreds of thousands of buddhas, many millions of buddhas, many tens of millions of buddhas, many billions of buddhas, many tens of billions of buddhas, many trillions of buddhas, and many quintillions of buddhas,

original: de dag gi drung na slob pa'i tshe dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa byin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab sgom pa dag yod de /
analyzed: de dag gi drung na slob pa'i tshe dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa byin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab sgom pa dag yod de /
translated: and in their presence, when they were training, they gave gifts, guarded morality, cultivated patience, made an effort at perseverance, became absorbed in concentration, and cultivated wisdom, all with the idea of reference.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: They are

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na 'khor de nas 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na 'khor de nas 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: When this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, they will leave that assembly.

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Those sons of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni /üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na gus pa med pas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na gus pa med pas /
translated: and those daughters of a good family

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi drung nas 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will, when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught, leave the presence of those lord buddhas without respect.

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Those sons of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo theg pa chen po pa de dag ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo theg pa chen po pa de dag ni /
translated: and those daughters of a good family who are followers of the Great Vehicle

original: 'di nyid du'ang 'dus te /
analyzed: 'di nyid du'ang 'dus te /
translated: will gather right here

original: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston @86b pa na 'gro bar byed pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston @86b pa na 'gro bar byed pa dag yin no //
translated: and will leave when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni /
translated: It is because those bodhisattva great beings

original: sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa na phyir song bar gyur la; da ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na'ang de dag phyir 'gro bar byed cing /
analyzed: sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa na phyir song bar gyur la; da ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na'ang de dag phyir 'gro bar byed cing /
translated: In the past, when this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom was being taught, they departed, and now, when this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom is being taught, they depart.

original: lus dang sems kyi tshogs par mi byed pas /üîΩde dag shes rab 'chal par 'gyur ba'i las gsog par 'gyur te; de dag gis shes rab 'chal bar 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa des /
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi tshogs par mi byed pas / de dag shes rab 'chal par 'gyur ba'i las gsog par 'gyur te; de dag gis shes rab 'chal bar 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa des /
translated: They do not accumulate physical and mental collections.üîΩThey accumulate karma that will lead to their having poor insight, and

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because of the karma that they have created and accumulated that will lead to their having poor insight, when this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom is being taught, they will reject it.

original: de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spangs pas /
analyzed: de dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spangs pas /
translated: Because they have rejected this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang spangs par gyur la /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang spangs par gyur la /
translated: they will also reject the omniscience of the lord buddhas of the past, future, and present.

original: de dag gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid spangs pa las byung ba'i las mngon par 'du bya ba byas shing bsags pa de dang / chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa des /
analyzed: de dag gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid spangs pa las byung ba'i las mngon par 'du bya ba byas shing bsags pa de dang / chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa des /
translated: They will have created and accumulated karma that leads to the abandonment of omniscience, and they will have created and accumulated karma that leads to the loss of the Dharma.

original: lo mang po dang / lo brgya phrag mang po dang / lo stong phrag mang po dang / lo 'bum phrag mang po dang / lo bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag mang po'i bar du sems can dmyal ba rnams su sreg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo mang po dang / lo brgya phrag mang po dang / lo stong phrag mang po dang / lo 'bum phrag mang po dang / lo bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag mang po'i bar du sems can dmyal ba rnams su sreg par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, they will burn in the hells for many years, many hundreds of years, many thousands of years, many hundreds of thousands of years, many millions of years, many tens of millions of years, many billions of years, and many tens of billions of years.

original: de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams nas sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams nas sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will go from one great hell to another great hell.

original: de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams nas sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro ba na mes 'jig pa 'am /
analyzed: de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams nas sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro ba na mes 'jig pa 'am /
translated: When they go from one great hell to another great hell, there will be a great fire,

original: chus 'jig pa 'am /
analyzed: chus 'jig pa 'am /
translated: a great flood,

original: rlung gis @87a *//üîΩ'jig pa dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rlung gis @87a *//üîΩ'jig pa dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: and a great wind.

original: de dag der 'jig pa dag byung ba na /
analyzed: de dag der 'jig pa dag byung ba na /
translated: When those worlds are destroyed,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag gi sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams gang yin pa de dag tu 'phen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag gi sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams gang yin pa de dag tu 'phen par 'gyur ro //
translated: they are cast into the great hells of other worlds.

original: de dag der skyes nas kyang sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams nas sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dag der skyes nas kyang sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams nas sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Having been born there, they go from great hell to great hell.

original: de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams nas sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro ste /
analyzed: de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams nas sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro ste /
translated: From great hell to great hell they go,

original: yang 'jig pa byung ba na de dag 'jig rten gyi khams de dag nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu 'phen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'jig pa byung ba na de dag 'jig rten gyi khams de dag nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu 'phen par 'gyur ro //
translated: and when those worlds are destroyed, they are cast into other worlds.

original: de dag tu'ang gang gi tshe 'jig pa byung ba na de dag shar phyogs su 'phen par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag tu'ang gang gi tshe 'jig pa byung ba na de dag shar phyogs su 'phen par 'gyur /
translated: There, when those worlds are destroyed, they are cast into the eastern direction.

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs mtshams rnams dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs rnams kyi sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'phen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs mtshams rnams dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs rnams kyi sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'phen par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be hurled into the great hells in the south, the west, the north, the intermediate directions, below and above.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag tu'ang 'jig pa byung ba na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag tu'ang 'jig pa byung ba na /
translated: And when the destruction of the world occurs in those worlds,

original: de dag 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag gi sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'phen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag gi sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'phen par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will be hurled into the great hells in other worlds.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag tu'ang 'jig pa byung ba na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag tu'ang 'jig pa byung ba na /
translated: And when the destruction of the world occurs in those worlds,

original: chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las ma zad pas /üîΩ'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag nas shi 'phos nas yang 'di nyid du skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las ma zad pas / 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag nas shi 'phos nas yang 'di nyid du skye bar 'gyur zhing /

original: de dag yang sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams nas sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag yang sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams nas sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And they will go from one great hell to another great hell.

original: de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po de rnams su skyes pa @87b na'ang sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal rnams nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dag sems can dmyal ba chen po de rnams su skyes pa @87b na'ang sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal rnams nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing /

original: ji srid du 'jig pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur bde srid du sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal rnams nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro; ;'jig pa byung ba na'ang 'di nas shi 'phos nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag gi sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su skyeüîΩbar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du 'jig pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur bde srid du sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal rnams nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro; ;'jig pa byung ba na'ang 'di nas shi 'phos nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag gi sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the destruction of the world occurs, they will die and be reborn in the great hells of other worlds.

original: de bzhin du yang nas yang du phyogs bcu kun gyi dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams su'ang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang nas yang du phyogs bcu kun gyi dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams su'ang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, they will be born again and again in the animal realms of all ten directions.

analyzed: yang dang yang du phyogs bcu kun gyi gshin rje'i 'jig rten rnams su'ang skye bar 'gyur te /
